conbody.p: A flow is used to connect activities in a workflow (or business process) and show the order in which the activities will be performed. Flows can also be used to show the flow of messages between two pools.

Workflow diagrams consist mainly of flow objects that are connected by flows. Each flow has only one source flow object (e.g., event, activity, or gateway) and one target flow object (e.g., event, activity, or gateway). For more information, see sections , , and .
